result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua Adam Czap was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joshua Adam Czap is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Joshua Adam Czap was found guilty of Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Joshua Adam Czap was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Joshua Adam Czap was found guilty of Maintain Drug Trafficking Place, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
9:37 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Joshua Adam Czap in court.  Attorney Mark Walter Frank in court for Joshua Adam Czap.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Steiner is heard on sentencing recommendations. Withheld sentence, 3 years probation, Complete Crawford County Treatment Court, 60 days jail for count 1. 
Attorney Frank is heard. Agrees for all except the 60 days jail.
Attorney Steiner comments, defense is free to argue. 

Court reviews plea questionnaire and waiver of rights form with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews the constitutional and fundamental rights with Defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews the elements of the charge with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews the minimum / maximum penalties with defendant. Defendant states understanding. 

Court asks defendant for plea. Defendant enters a no contest plea for counts 1, 4, and 7. Court accepts the defendants no contest pleas and finds that the defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily enters plea. Court finds the defendant guilty of counts 1,4, and 7.  

Ct 1 - 346.04(3) - Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer (1)
Ct 2 - 941.30(1) - 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety (1)
Ct 3 - 941.30(1) - 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety (1)
Ct 4 - 961.41(3g)(g) - Possession of Methamphetamine (1)
Ct 5 - 961.573(1) - Possess Drug Paraphernalia (1)
Ct 6 - 946.41(1) - Resisting or Obstructing an Officer (1)
Ct 7 - 961.42(1) - Maintain Drug Trafficking Place (1)

State is heard on sentencing recommendations. recommendations. Withheld sentence, 3 years probation, Complete Crawford County Treatment Court, 60 days jail for count 1. 
Attorney Frank is heard. Agrees for all except the 60 days jail. Jail credit only in the event of revocation. Requests the jail be served promptly. 
Attorney Frank is heard on sentencing recommendations. Requests probation, not 60 days jail. 
Defendant is heard. 

Court orders for counts 1, 4, 7 - Withheld sentence, 3 years probation, Successfully Complete Crawford County Treatment Court, 60 days jail for count 1, Huber/Electronic Monitoring Approved. Court will give defendant 30 days to report, defendant to report on or before October 26th 2022 at 6:30 PM. 
Participate in any other assessments as deemed appropriate by the Department of Corrections and follow through with recommended counseling, treatment or programming. Court costs to be assessed, 3 felony court costs total of $1,554.00. 52 days credit  to be given to count 1 in the event of probation being revoked. 6 months DL Revocation. 

State moves to dismiss counts 2, 3, 5, 6. Court dismisses counts 2, 3, 5, 6.

PP approved, combine defendants PP of $100.00 per month. Commencing on new due date of January 1, 2023.

Atty Steiner is heard. Does not oppose bond modification. 
Court is not ready to release defendant until a suitable plan is in place.
